file_content.text: Ord Mantell--the sooner I'm away from it, the better.
Have you found my necklace yet? Please, tell me you've found it.
Is it true you work for the Empire?
I heard you're a spy.
Why did you say you wanted this necklace again?
Remind me why you wanted it.
It's a family heirloom. I wanted to have it to give to my daughter.
Don't you mean "communication device"?
Is it really a necklace?
Ha. Where--where would you get such a silly idea?
Now, are you going to give me the necklace?
Go ahead. Take it and leave this place.
Yes.
Good. I knew I could count on you.
No problem.
Aw, don't be so modest. You've done an immeasurable service.
We had a deal.
Oh, of course, of course.
I just hope I haven't made a grave mistake.
I'd better not regret this.
That's silly, of course not! You've just made a woman and her daughter incredibly happy.
Thank you so much!
Actually, um, I don't have it. So, no.
[Lie] Sorry, no necklace.
Oh, well, please hurry. Talloran village, remember?
Have you found my necklace yet?
Oh no! Where is it? Oh no!
What am I going to do? What? What?
What's the problem?
I don't know. What are you gonna do?
You tell me.
Oh I wish I knew. I just wish I knew.
It can't be all that serious.
Is it that bad?
I don't know how you could think that. Haven't you seen what this war has done?
It was terrible! The separatists came to Talloran village in the night and drove us out of our homes--we had to leave everything behind. We lost it all!
We've all lost something in this war.
Everyone has.
I know, I know. I will be so glad when it's over.
I'm sorry.
Thank you for your sympathy.
It happens.
How can you be so callous?
I won't ever get my home back, I know that. But when I fled, I left behind an heirloom that belonged to my great-grandmother.
If I could just have that heirloom back--it would be like having a piece of my old life to carry with me forever.
Can I help?
I guess that necklace is pretty important to you.
Sounds valuable.
Yes, please, would you find it for me? Would you bring back my heirloom?
If you're paying, I might be able to look.
Is there money involved?
I--I don't have much, but I'd gladly give all of it just to have the heirloom back.
Please--I've lost my home, I've lost everything. But if, one day, I do manage to get off this planet, I just want to take this one thing.
You will get the necklace for me, won't you?
Sure.
I can't guarantee anything.
Just see about the pay.
Oh thank you, thank you. Oh, I don't know what I would've done without you. Thank you.
I've lost my home. I still can't believe it.
